website_summaries.verdict: No worries about weight with these slats rated to hold up to 1,600 pounds.
pros: No need for a box spring
Sits at 18-inches, which gives you a lot of under the bed storage
cons: These slats may have a tendency to squeak and the metal corners can be sharp

customer_reviews.title: Happy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 foot 9 inches and ordered the Cali King version of this. This is a fantastic frame for my Tuft and Needle mattress with no box spring. I am satisfied for sure. It was stupid easy to put together. The design of this bed frame was well thought out. I was quite impressed really. The cross sections that go from head to foot are jointed in the center so it makes for a sturdy/solid sit on the floor. I'm sure this will be 100% fine for extra curricular activity, The center section has 8 bars running across that have a special notch with special markers on them. Its all labeled well.
customer_reviews.author: Gutter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, and inexpensive, plus storage!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big girl, and hate feeling my bed creaking underneath me. This frame took me about 15 minutes to put together by myself, and it doesn't MOVE when I get in bed. Combined withand, old IKEA mattress has never been more comfortable or sturdy feeling!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent frame for my Cali King. Doesn't make a sound at all, not one squeak or creek, which was important for me. Sturdy as heck too. And di I mention a TON of storage underneath? Its like an extra closet under there! Highly reccomended. I would buy another loke it if I needed a second frame.
customer_reviews.author: High Speed Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both big people and based off of the specs should have had no problem with with weight. Within a few weeks of having this bed frame the many welds broke and the legs broke at the welds. The legs and majority of the frame was made of aluminum and the slats were steel. Completely not worth the purchase. Although with as high as it was it had great storage. Thankfully though Amazon gave us a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Darcey

customer_reviews.title: It will hold your bed, but be ready for the SQUEAK!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our new Nectar mattress. For the first 2 weeks, everything was good. My only complaint is that it didn't have rubber ends on the feet, so it slid around a bit on our hardwood floors in the bedroom. HOWEVER, after about 2 weeks of normal use, it started squeaking a bit. No biggie, I thought. I tried tightening the bolts a bit, but that didn't help much. After about another month, and now the bed squeaks so much just from getting in and out of bed that it disturbs everybody. I can't even shift my sleeping position in the morning without waking my partner. Dislike!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The opposite of heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even had this for 6 months, and it's been fine until today when I decided to rearrange my bedroom. I left my 70 lb mattress on the bed and pushed/pulled the whole thing across my carpeted floor (I know it's not the wisest but I live alone and it was the easiest way) and THE LEGS SNAPPED OFF. I'm sorry but how "heavy duty" is it if it can't be moved across a floor ONE TIME! Incredibly annoyed and upset. Btw this is the first and only time it has been moved and I'm the only one on the bed so it's not weakened from "shenanigans"
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Schneider

customer_reviews.title: That I get a refund
customer_reviews.text: we moved into our house on June 2. last night my husband who weighs all of 180 lbs rolled over and 6 cross bars came crashing to the floor.. now they won't stay in I'm incredibly disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty quick to put together
customer_reviews.text: We were about to replace our mattress we were so frustrated with our sagging bed. Neither of us were sleeping very well. We ditched our box spring and replaced it with this. We have tons of storage under the bed and can't believe it is the same mattress. It was pretty quick to put together, is really stable and we still can't believe our mattress is even with no sagging anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: So far we have slept on the frame for a week or two. It has a good hold. My husband is 400+ pounds and I am 200+ and we both feel secure in the bed. Also it is plenty big considering we have a California King. The room underneath is great for storage since we are in such a small room we are able to fit a small metal stool and other things under the bed. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together and sturdy. Our weight combined is just over 500lbs and no issues after a week. There are no edges to hold mattress so depending on weight of mattress it can slide some but so far it hasn't been a serious issue :) love the height gives room a cleaner look. And allows room for dog beds and possible storage.
customer_reviews.author: Annie13

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive platform bed
customer_reviews.text: I looked for one of these for sometime for a guest room bed. I wanted the height for under bed storage and a simple light design. It looks great and despite some negative reviews, the bed doesn't squeak or creak at all. Very sturdy, easily accommodated 400 lbs. Long enough to sleep 6' plus tall people w/out feet hanging over. My floor is carpeted, so I added pads under the legs because it will leave indents in the carpet w/out them. I would suggest this be put together by 2 people, 1 can do it but it went easier with 2 people. It took us under 15 minutes to assemble. I would purchase again if the need presents itself again.
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: It’s been about 3 months and the top part of it broke. I’m so disappointed because I really loved the idea of not needing to buy a base piece for the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: 16 Inches of Clearance for Storage
customer_reviews.text: Single male in a studio apartment. Installation is fairly straight forward, though the directions are poorly written. During my install I questioned the clearance I had understood this bed was supposed to give (18"). I let it go and wrapped up. As I thought, it unfortunately under-delivered by 2" as pictured. I must have misunderstood the meaning of 18", though I do think the actual clearance should be denoted as 16", since it is likely needed for storage. Realistically decreases storage room by 960 cubic inches. Otherwise, seems to be just fine. I will update this as things progress (sturdiness, ease to install headboard, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: This was a deeply disappointing product purchase. For something that is mass produced, I am amazed that one of the holes could be drilled so off placement. It is held together with a total of 14 screws, one of which I cannot put in the hole. So it will work for a time, but ultimately break far sooner than it should’ve. If you buy this, just hope you’re lucky and you don’t get something so poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: very easy and quick to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I'm a notoriously fussy shopper, and I'm horribly lazy. When my old bed was falling apart, I had a lot of anxiety just about replacing it at all. I wanted something simple but better built than my old one. This bed did not disappoint one little bit. It came quick. It was super easy to assemble, and it's solid as a rock. It's nothing fancy, mind you. But if you need a simple bed frame that looks nicer than your average cheap frame, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Horne

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st negative review I have had to write, but people need warned. Frame bent after 2 days (with only 190 lbs total sleeping on it), making all the slats fall through. Would not stay together and ruined my brand new mattress. Only giving it 2 stars because it came fast and was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Good stable frame
customer_reviews.text: The biggest thing that impressed me was the styrofoam was sealed so you don’t have tiny styrofoam pieces all over your floor. I’ve never seen that before. Besides that the pieces aren’t labeled and it may take a bit to figure out, this frame is very easy to put together. The hardware is easily labeled. They even give you extra hardware, which is labeled so you don’t freak out when you’re done and have leftover pieces. I would recommend this frame!
customer_reviews.author: SV and JV

customer_reviews.title: Great frame, ease to put together
customer_reviews.text: This frame was really easy to put together and seems pretty darn sturdy. The amount of storage space I now have under my bed is perfect. I was able to put a plastic storage container about 11.5 inches in height under that contains big winter blankets. I however didn’t measure the true height of my mattress and box spring with this frame in mind. (I had recently purchased a new mattress and box spring before I purchased the frame) Needless to say I need a step stool to get on my bed as the top of my mattress comes up to my waist. I’m only 5’2in tall but it’s not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksally101

customer_reviews.title: Frame was broken and bent upon delivery
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. Bed showed up and it looked like it already had normal wear. Additionally, the middle part of the frame was bent and the corner brackets were coming off of the frame. It would have been impossible to even attempt to set it up. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Brett & Court

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a cali king size frame for our master bedroom and tried it out for a month and love the quality and ease of putting together the frame. The instructions say to make sure bolts are tighten to reduce noise and we don't hear a thing! So we ordered the queen size bed frame for our guest room and the quality is exactly same build. It's got some weight to it but not so heavy that would prevent 1 person from building and moving the frame. love it and will consider buying again from sleeplace.
customer_reviews.author: Kao Saephanh

customer_reviews.title: THE SQUEEKING IS DRIVING ME CRAZY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the most disappointing purchase! This says "heavy duty" but, if you put this ok carpet, it's NOT sturdy at all. My biggest complaint is THE SQUEEKING!!! This is the LOUDEST bedframe imaginable. I wouldn't recommend for anyone who tosses and turns during the night!
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put together. Could have done it with one person. There is a HUGE amount of storage underneath- easily fits a full sized tote. With my 14 inch mattress on top this bed is so tall. I'm only 5 foot tall and I have to boost myself into bed! Right for the price- Especially as it saved me from having to buy a box spring! My husband is around 240lbs... no problem holding that weight with no squeaks.
customer_reviews.author: T Ward

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty strong, and the height is nice (although
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty strong, and the height is nice (although, with a mattress as thick as mine, I'm nearly jumping to get into bed), but also seems a little larger than it should be. Specifically longer... by about 4 inches. It's not a huge deal, but with the sharp corners sticking out, it's already banged up a couple knees. I also think it could have used an additional support beam at the head and foot of the bed. If the mattress is too far in one direction or the other (which, due to those extra 4 inches it almost always is) it will sink down into the gap a little.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Bush

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just follow the directions very easy to assemble. We arw waiting for our new mattress but we placed our old sinking mattress on it and the difference is amazing. Made it feel supported. My husband is 6'5 330- I am 5' 145 sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.SaltyJP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed frame!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy construction! Went together in about 30 minutes or less. Plenty of storage space underneath which allows for space to put things if you have a smaller space to work with. This bed does not squeak at all which is really nice. Very sturdy and has held up for quite some time! Would recommend to someone else and would buy again if I ever needed to. This product would be really easy to move as all of the parts are easy to take apart and once assembled the frame is light so it would be easy to simply pick up and carry if you didn't want to take apart the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle K.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty Of Storage Space
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy bedframe that in my opinion is not as easy for one person to assemble as some here would have you believe. However, if you have the time and strength to handle the many metal pieces as you attach them to one another, it is doable without requiring an advance degree in carpentry. Before you start assembling, I suggest you lay all items of like size together. The Allen wrench provided was all I used and after several months of use the frame is just as sturdy as it was the first night with no squeaks or movement. Be advised elbow grease is required if power tools are not at your disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griffon

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I hadn’t my doubts when I assembled this bed frame that it would last. The materials seemed weak and the joints were welded together poorly. Sure enough, after six months of use I noticed that the support part of the frame had cracked the top of the welds on all the connecting pieces. The bed could collapse and fall to the floor any day now. Now I’m waiting on my new bed frame to be delivered before I can sleep safely. Do not buy if you want something that will last longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: A&N

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy about this it has mixed reviews. But I went ahead and purchased it. It’s great!! Husband and My total weight combined is 527 pounds. We have a Purple brand mattress on it and it is excellent, It’s extremely sturdy. And it is not squeaky or loud. It was quick and easy to assemble. It comes with everything you need to put it together. The instructions are very easy to follow. It sits tall I can store boxes under it. It does have slots to add your head and footboard to it. Over all it is a great bed frame well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: AdrianRichie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My husband and 14-year-old son put it together. It does not squeak. It is much more comfortable, and we have a 12'' memory foam on top. It's really helped my back for it to be so high off of the ground, as any squatting to get out of bed was excruciating. I'm extremely overweight, and this has helped me with my sleep and morning pains. We've had it a couple of weeks, no squeaking, no flaws in the product. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: ACruz

customer_reviews.title: You must buy! You will not be disappointed in the quality, construction and versatility for storage
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with this purchase. I did a LOT of research trying to find the best option for us. Our mattress is super floppy(one of those beauty rest pillow tops) so we needed a lot of support for the mattress(bc we don’t have a boxspring). We are also heavy people, 415 total, so I knew us plus the mattress would be over many of the maximum weights allowed for bed frames. This had great reviews and is tall enough to store a TON of bins under the bed. I love it!! You must buy! You will not be disappointed in the quality, construction and versatility for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Paul Bourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Cal King Proportions Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I liked the 18 inches of extra storage, and it is sturdy, but I ordered a California King and there is a large 7.5” gap that I will need to find something to fill, as the bed frame is way too long. I put the toothpaste in the picture to give context. If I leave the gap at the foot end, I’m afraid I would hurt my legs on the corners jutting out, so I will have to purchase a piece of foam to fill this gap.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I put it together myself & it didn't take too long. Sturdy - I'm heavy and it doesn't move or squeak! No issues & I've had it for a few weeks. I'm 5'6 and its almost too tall, but I have a 12 inch mattress on it. You don't need a box spring & a 7 inch mattress would probably be fine. You'll have tons of storage space underneath!
customer_reviews.author: Renee G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't regret it, but pay attention for assembly
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly simple to assemble, but the directions were not clear. I accidentally put one of the head pieces in the bottom spot. I tried to unscrew the frame to swap them, and the screws stripped even with the simple handheld tools included. The frame is great and sturdy. The height is awesome and it is a solid choice. I just wish the included hardware was a better quality. I now have to zip tie my headboard to the frame because the soft metal screws stripped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too long for California king.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! I thought this frame would be perfect for our California king but it’s about 4-5 inches too long??? Yes I’m sure our mattress is a Cali king not a regular king. Not compatible with a pillow top as the mattress slides around the entire frame. Feels sturdy and doesn’t make noise but you can’t even sit at the end of your bed without it sinking down through the bars of the frame. Maybe adding plywood would help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, taking me only about 30 minutes. The frame is very sturdy and quiet, no squeaking or anything. I got the California King size and it's perfect. As a tall guy, I love the height and the added bonus of storage space underneath is a big plus. If you're of average or below height, you may want to be wary of using high profile box springs with this frame, otherwise you'll need a step stool to get onto the bed.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I love the height of this! I actually have it mounted on 7.25" furniture risers...I have large breed dogs and wanted them to be able to sleep under the bed, rather than in my walking path if I got out of bed. The foundation is pretty solid, it wasn't too heavy (I'm 51 and not quite as buff as I used to be), and I was able to put it together by myself. I'm single, so there isn't any extreme activity truly testing out the bed frame. And, no, the dogs haven't figured out they have room to sleep under the bed yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: After almost 2 years, still doesn’t squeak!
customer_reviews.text: Almost two years later, after daily use, this is still perfect. It doesn’t squeak, it’s incredibly sturdy, and it is high enough off the ground to store our luggage underneath. We are not small people (plus size/big and tall), either. I’d buy it again, but it looks like I won’t have to!
customer_reviews.author: jrps

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high, easy to setup, wished it was a little closer to mattress size
customer_reviews.text: All metal, 10 bolts, goes together quick & easy with decent instructions. Seems very sturdy, can't wait to try it out for non sleeping purposes but I think it'll be just fine. Wished it was a little lower, like 12 or 14" but it works. If your under 5'6, your feet won't touch the floor while sitting on the bed but tons of room underneath for whatever you need to store. Only minor issue is it's a little bigger outside than mattress
customer_reviews.author: Thatguyken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the height, well made and very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: lana d.

customer_reviews.title: it's what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I like the height of this platform. i like having the storage. getting out of bed is easier with the taller platform. it was not difficult to assemble myself but a helper would have made it easier. I am a larger guy, sleeping on this is very comfortable with no issues. I may get under it and check the fasteners. I may go through and apply some blue loctite on the threads.
customer_reviews.author: BoneHead

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble. It fit out bed nicely. I recommend getting something to pad the legs because they hurt it you accidently his them with your toe. I subtracted a start for the instructions. They could have been more descriptive. It just takes a few more minutes to figure out what they mean in the pictures. UPDATE: Now that I've had this bed frame for a few months I must say that it is now the SQUEEKIEST THING I'VE EVER SLEPT ON!!!!! I'm afraid to move sometimes because it's so squeaky!!! Anyone have any suggestions on what to do???!!! Uggghhhhh.. I wish I would have gotten a normal frame and box spring at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Tasia

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: Buying a high bed frame is the best thing I ever did. Living in an apartment that lacks storage this has been so helpful. I can keep suitcases, storage bins, and Christmas decorations. I couldn’t recommend this more. Getting a higher bed frame instead of a box spring is a better solution. It pops together easily and I haven’t had issues in almost 6 months of use. The only thing you might have to worry about is stubbing your toe on the metal rods. An easy hack for that is to wrap them in pool noodles or drink cookies for cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Easy/sturdy/great!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to assemble. This frame has more legs on it than another brand I also have so it is super-sturdy. Quiet, lots of storage room underneath. I wanted even more room so I use 6" risers and have tons of storage. These legs are thick enough they sit firmly on the risers. Great purchase...I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TN Lady

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Husband set up the frame last night. Took about 20-30 min from opening the box to putting sheets on the bed. It doesn't creak as others have stated. We have a cali king and king bedskirt and it fits perfectly. Feels sturdy for a plus size couple and its firmed up our mattress. 18 gallon storage tub will fit if its 15 3/4 size, there's a fingertip space left to slide in and out. First night a success, will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: BlueberryDonut

customer_reviews.title: Great frame
customer_reviews.text: We've had this frame for a month now and it has helpnup pretty well. It is strong and does not squeak from every movement. Much easier to assemble than the wooden frames. It is very tall and we have a 13in mattress on it, so there is no need to use a box spring, but doesn't hurt our backs, so we're good without it. Lots of storage space underneath because of how tall it is, our kids use it to play hide and seek.
customer_reviews.author: Ekaterina Terentieva

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy bed frame
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to go with the live and sleep mattress we bought. It's a very durable bed frame. Our dog loves it because it's high enough off the ground that he can sleep under it. I'm only giving it 3 stars because it needs to have something to keep the mattress from sliding on the top of it. Every day or two we have to push the mattress back to one side or the other or back up against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: “Did you hear us last night? Sorry.”
customer_reviews.text: Pro’s: We can fit so much under our bed! Con’s: Incredibly squeaky! I’ve had to fasten bolts multiple times in 3 months. Maybe in total we are 800lbs including the mattress, still under the recommended 1200lb rating, so I’m not sure what we’re doing wrong. Suppose the manufacture expects its customers to practice abstinence....
customer_reviews.author: K. Botelho

customer_reviews.title: Meets all of my expectations
customer_reviews.text: It is as they said: Easy to construct & very sturdy. These (steel frame) beds advertise they do not need slats because they are built in. In my opinion there are half as many as should be. I repeat; all similar beds by other manufacturers are like that. Perhaps it would work as is but I wanted wood slats and closer together so we got a "Zinus Deepak Easy Assembly Wood Slat 1.6 Inch Bunkie Board / Bed Slat Replacement, Full which which fit very well inside the upper rails. Note: many other steel beds will not fit the wood slat platform. Overall we are very happy with the Sleeplace 18 Inch High Profile Heavy Duty Steel Bed Frame
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Field

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and a snap to put together. It gave us a lot of extra storage. Remember to measure you mattress with bedding on it because this thing is TALL. I definitely recommend padding the legs too. I padded it but only hit one with my bare foot a couple of times in a year. Unfortunately we all know how even one time can have a priest making up new curse words. Toes and solid steel do not go together. The bed is really stable for this height. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Robert The Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bed frame that allows for extra storage space.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bed frame! We wanted a relatively inexpensive bed frame that allowed for extra storage space due to our very limited space (we live in a tiny 1 bedroom apartment) and that didn't need a box spring or anything. This fit the bill, so we got it. It is super easy to put together and takes very little time to do so. It is sturdy, looks really good, and doesn't creak or anything. It's rather tall compared to most other bed frames, but leaves plenty of under-the-bed storage space which is really nice. It is designed so that a headboard can be attached too, which is also nice.
customer_reviews.author: Shillo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional...you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.text: The simplest bed to assemble. They do need to work a little on their packaging and presentation. When I initially opened it, it looked like pieces were missing. Instructions are decent. Well thought out design. I added a 1/4 ply for added support as I used a 3 inch latex mattress topper instead of those spring matresses. Love the storage space under the bed. My 2 year old often goes under the bed to hide. :) For the price, it's excellent. Do consider buying this if you are replacing your bed. I am not paid to write this review...just an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Ashwin Nayak

customer_reviews.title: Use with a box spring
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this bed frame. It was easy to put together and gave my wife and I tons of extra storage space. It's now been around a year and its destroyed my bed. The slats are are too far apart and now my bed sags making me super aware of the bars below. I'm now replacing my old pillow top with a low profile box spring and a memory foam mattress. It's a great bed frame, but do not use it without a low profile box spring. I'm 25 and this box spring has made my back feel like it belongs to an 80 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Angela T.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Extremely uncomfortable you felt the individual bars with no box springs. Also seller only allows a 28 day window for returns that is not enough time for a bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Romine

customer_reviews.title: Land of Giants...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love! My husband and I are both over 6 foot tall (hes 6'6 and I'm 6'1) and not small people and have lots of problems with the bed bowing in the regular frames. We decided to switch to a platform style frame hoping that would help. The 1st night we slept the best we have in months! It was easy to assemble and just the right height. So for anyone wanting to know this frame will definitely hold close to 600lbs if assembled correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed frame! It's sturdy, it's easy to assemble, and the space underneath it is excellent. I enjoy that I don't need to use a box spring, and my mattress fits perfectly. My cat finds it cozy to hide under and fun to pounce on the puppy from. However, it really hurts to stub your toe on the bars!
customer_reviews.author: Tobias

customer_reviews.title: Looks better than pictures
customer_reviews.text: It looks better than in the picture and the color is soft, easy to match with any other color in the room or bedding because it's literally a neutral, light, soft cream/peach/beige color and when I'm telling you that it's equally any of the three depending on what other color you put next to it or your lights in the room put out, do believe me :))) Great buy for us, looks amazing with our bed.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Toma

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Good durability and set up was very easy. I had a girl on her way over and had to kick it in overdrive to set this bad boy up but I timed myself and it took 25 minutes. Neither of us were dissapointed in the performance. Comes with necessary hardware. The added 4” in height compared to my 14” makes a big difference, gives it a more mature look. Been sleeping on it for a few weeks and haven’t heard any squeaks or signs of weakness
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan  Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: This bed frame is nice and tall
customer_reviews.text: Put this together yesterday in about 1 hour mostly by myself. I needed my husband to help me when I attached the middle support, just cause the weight of the other side made it difficult to attach the side I was holding. We got a Cal King and have a really heavy memory foam mattress that sunk into the last bed frame we purchased 5 years ago. This bed frame is nice and tall, is solid, and my mattress is not going to sink or sag on it. I think if we had bought this frame five years ago we would still have it. This was a GREAT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Benaho

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks after a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Went together easy but after a couple of weeks it has started to squeak. Was put together tightly with power drill since the cheap Allen wrench that came with it was so soft it was unusable after 3 screws. Ok for the price considering how expensive a steel bed can be these days. That squeak is annoying though. Slats are 7 inches apart.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit our king size mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit my king size bed. Their is at least 2" of overage on every side of the bed. This means we are constantly bumping into it and it looks junky since it doesn't fit a king size mattress properly. It was semi easy to install and doesn't squeak much. We bought it for the under bed storage capabilities but will have to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Youaremysunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - no real issues - would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for about a year and half and am very pleased. There are times when I'm moving it or adjusting the mattress where a slat may come out. But it pops back in. This isn't a fault of the unit, I have an extremely heavy mattress as well as too many things under the bed lol. Totally recommend this unit!
customer_reviews.author: Raj Donald

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This bed is garbage, didn't even last us a year before it started to break. First the California king was to wide AND too long, then after a while the slats kept falling off then the center support leg bent and it began to rust
customer_reviews.author: ogrelady

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice frame. Pros-No squeaking, mattress does not slip around, GREAT storage space underneath, the dog thinks it’s a den! Cons-bit larger than a queen. My dust ruffle won’t fit side to side (not a cheep under sized brand)and legs come out far, so if you have a small room, it will be easy to stub your toe.
customer_reviews.author: reader99

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this was to assemble. It looks great with simple lines and fits our storage boxes underneath. Super sturdy. A big step up from the standard frame that comes with a bed and allowed me to skip the box spring, the top mattress I have is about 7 inches thick and just fine by itself (if you're concerned about the spacing of the support bars, no worries). Great height.
customer_reviews.author: Kerosine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with headboard
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble, lots of storage underneath and is sturdy. I really with the picture wasn't so misleading because i assmed it was coming with the head board :( Walmart has a $50 just metal part similar to this, i would have gone with that if i knew it didnt come with the headboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality overall.
customer_reviews.text: The bed frame made noise lots of noise, despite tightening the bolts thoroughly as directed by the instructions to avoid it. The bolts themselves were of very poor quality, and many of them stripped out. After 21⁄2 months, at least two of the uprights snapped at the weld points, and it's easy to see why, the steel tubing is very thin. I definitely DO NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Huge.
customer_reviews.text: So this is wayyy too huge for me - I don't know what I was thinking. I remember taking measuring tape into my room and thinking, "this'll be perfect," but apparently I misjudged. My mattress itself is about 18" deep and with the addition of this frame, my bed now comes up to my chest. This is totally my fault. So I gave 5 stars because it was very easy to put together and sturdy considering its simplicity and height.
customer_reviews.author: payforcrap

customer_reviews.title: ie=UTF8&psc=1 It is very sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: This bed is exactly what I needed for my son's room. It is high enough to put decent size boxes underneath for storage. Here is a link to the boxes I used.  It is very sturdy and secure. We put a memory foam mattress on it and it doesn't sink through at all. We attached a headboard to it easily and it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: MW2

customer_reviews.title: The best bed frame I have ever owned.  I'll never change from it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both quite plus-sized. This bed frame does NOT squeak, was easy to assemble and I love the added storage space under the bed! We love that we no longer need a box spring! There is so much support that are backs are feeling better and we don't feel like anything we ever could do on this bed could ever break it or anything. It is INCREDIBLY durable! Buy it! You will never need another frame!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and rock solid bed frame.
customer_reviews.text: It works great with our new Nectar memory foam mattress. We did have to buy two 4' by 8' by 1/2" thick plywood cut into two pieces to lay over the slots, otherwise the memory foam base would bulge through the bottom and I didn't want to ruin our new mattress. I was expecting to have to do that anyways. It's much better than having a box spring underneath. It took me about an hour to assemble it with the supplied tools. I would highly recommend to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: jenkins748

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery of this frame being sturdy enough for my husband. My husband is well over 6 foot and weighs around 300lbs. This frame has performed beautifully. That said I I’m short so I do use a little step stool to help me crawl into bed but it’s worth it for the u see bed storage.
customer_reviews.author: c.a.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: This bed frame was one of the best purchases I've made for my guest room! Assembly was unbelievably easy ( maybe 10 minutes with two people) and the clearance from the floor makes under-the-bed storage convenient even with taller boxes. The frame itself is strong and durable, and a bed skirt will hide the frame if you don't want the frame visible. I would definitely buy another one if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and a solid product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the frame for a spear bedroom in my dad's home. He's a little older, but stated three times that the frame took less than 10 minutes to put together. My dad also said that he loves the hight of the frame and the fact that he doesn't need to purchase a box spring for the mattress. The extra plus is that he can now store all of his "toys (model cars)" under the bed....
customer_reviews.author: Duval Girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height, sturdy, and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Cal King size...Easy to install. Seems quite sturdy even after a few weeks of use. My Tuft and Needle foam mattress works great with this foundation. It's tall enough to put full size suitcases under it.
customer_reviews.author: Randal

customer_reviews.title: So stable an easy to assemble - I'm buying another for my guest room
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Very sturdy! I purchased it for a base for a purple mattress. I do wish they thought to have holes for a footboard. They do have one for a head board. My old bed was all oak. They slats and foundation were shoot. But I'm not giving up the headboard or footboard. I attached them with zip ties. You need a bedskirt or pad or else the sheets hang through the slats.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Toe stubber.
customer_reviews.text: Ours started falling apart in less than 6 months of use. The slats underneath have been falling out. Also the corners and legs stick out quite a bit from the matress causing us to stubb out toes, knock our knees and loose toenails. Super tall too. Make sure you realize how high this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Louise O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: A little long, but great overall
customer_reviews.text: While the instructions were not as clear as I would have liked, the assembly was rather intuitive. This replace a set of worn box springs and as made my Helix mattress feel brand new again. The only small negative is that the frame is slightly longer than the mattress so we covered the exposed portion with pool noodles to protect from banging our legs on the corners.
customer_reviews.author: K. Frei

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy, 350-375 pounds. I was a bit wary of how this would work, but it works great. It’s design is very sturdy, and it could easily support twice my weight. Having the space is nice too. I didn’t know how my mattress would handle having less support, but it’s been fine as well. Only complaint is that the corners are really pointy, and will mess you up good if you’re not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks K.

customer_reviews.title: Bed Legs aren’t same length.
customer_reviews.text: This bed frame was a total waste. As you can see from the photo the legs aren’t even the same size so the shorter one doesn’t even touch the floor. Tried to return but seller expected me to pay $35 to ship this poorly manufactured frame back. Don’t waste your money. Find a nicer frame.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Besides bruising it's great
customer_reviews.text: Solid and easy to assemble. I stub my knee and toes often. Design needs help.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Quite tall - nice and sturdy -  not hard to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sturdy bead frame! QUITE TAll! It works fantastic for providing extra storage. I haven't found a bed skirt that hides it, yet. But, I don't really mind the looks of the legs so I don't mind. The dogs like walking around under there like it's their own little house. My sweetie put it together with minimal cussing. lol
customer_reviews.author: LPallatin

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: complete junk don’t waste your money made from thin metal.. when I bought it the info I had was it can hold like 1500 pounds and will not Squeak so do the math 100 pounds mattress 125pound Gf and I’m 240 6ft5 it sounds like this bed is gonna fall threw my floor it pisses me off just to claim in and out of it now not to mention the frame tore from being such thin metal
customer_reviews.author: derek

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy frame
customer_reviews.text: SLEEPLACE SVC18F04C 18" CAL KING FRAME. Looking at this frame I was concerned it would be flimsy. That is not the case. This frame is well engineered. It does not rock or sqeak. I have used it for a month and am very pleased with purchase. One feature is the option to store stuff under the bed as there is plenty of room for 8 large (35L"x18"Wx13"T) plastic storage containers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO BIG ON SIZING.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this bed frame. It was so much larger than a cal king that I have metal slats that hang over and cause me to bruise my knees on the daily. It is so easy to assemble and super sturdy but the fact that it is so large is such a turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice but very tall
customer_reviews.text: This bed is very sturdy and well made. Lots of support and easy to put together. Buyer be aware tho , this is tall. We ended up cutting our legs down because it was rib high on me and I’m 5’6 with the mattress and box springs ( I am aware box springs aren’t needed with this foundation).
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Oversized, you bump into the corners
customer_reviews.text: I can't understand how this frame for a Cal King is so much larger than our brand new Cal King mattress from Costco. It should fit more accurately, with maybe just the width of the frame being larger than the mattress, but it is about 3" too large all around. This makes no sense and serves no purpose. I am very disappointed. Otherwise, it is heavy and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Miller

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased this in all sizes: twin, queen, and king. All great. Supports the mattresses very well. Great storage underneath the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Just One Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy On A Quite Sturdy Platform, Lots of Room Underneath
customer_reviews.text: Honestly its a little too high for me but a few months in it has been zero problem as a platform. Assembling it was fun! Much easier than I thought and once you figure out the fitting one half to the other the rest is so easy. Impressed with the quality of this. I'd have been happier with a the shorter version of this, but it is the right height for spanking.
customer_reviews.author: petej

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: Frame itself is nice and looks quality compared to others on market, however its an awkward size. We have a true to size king size mattress, and this frame is too long that the ends of the mattress fall between the bars on one side. Might work if there were slats ontop? Don't think this frame is a California King because it would be too wide (although matches length of one)
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Decent frame
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings when it comes to this frame. It’s very easy to put together and they also send spare bolts and screws, which is always nice. The frame itself is sturdy, so that’s not a problem. The only downfall I found is the fact that the mattress keeps sliding around on the frame. The frame should have lips on the side to prevent this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney W

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in 1 box, no tools required to assemble. Pretty heavy duty for the price, was pleasantly surprised. We did add a very thin piece of plywood to both sides to better support our memory foam mattress. Been in use for over a year with no issues. Not squeaky or wobbly at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Thorstad

customer_reviews.title: Tall but great for storage
customer_reviews.text: This bed is really tall, so if you have a thick mattress keep that in mind. It's great for storage and easy to clean the floors underneath. It also makes an awesome fort for kids, and the dog. The only drawback is that it wiggles alot when the other person moves in thier sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I didn’t quite understand how high 18 inches would be once we put the mattress on it and was overwhelmed with the height at first. However, if you want storage, it’s perfect. We have plastic bins underneath that are filled with extra blankets and bedding. It’s exactly what we needed and I’m glad that I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: A mom in MA

customer_reviews.title: Sizing slightly off
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, but somehow the cal king size seems off... my cal king puffy brand bed is almost too wide for the frame, and definitely about 3-4 inches too short for the frame (& I quadruple checked the bed/frame were facing appropriate direction). But other than that it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna graham

customer_reviews.title: So space is what you need?
customer_reviews.text: I love how much extra space this bed frame gives me. I am able to stuff all kinds of things under there. We have only been using this bed frame a few months and it is starting to get a little creaky. The only thing I really dislike about this bed frame is that it did not properly fit my box spring, which was the same size (ca king) so we had to get rid of that and just use the mattress- which works fine, but I’d have preferred to have more support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No squeak.
customer_reviews.text: No squeaks! Perfect height for using only a mattress. 10 inch mattress sits at good height. Also, no need for additional support. The metal bars hold a memory foam mattress without it falling through at all. The only bad thing is that it's like half an inch too small for the calories king dimensions and the mattress kinda just overlaps the edges barely. The edges can be tucked in but they always pop out eventually. It doesn't squeak! Throw the box spring things that smell and accumulate dust away and get this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: We have had the bed for a few months now. We wanted to go with a 10" memory foam mattress, and decided to get a simple frame with plenty of storage room under it. This does fit the bill perfectly. Shipping- fast, 5 stars. Boxing- perfect, 5 stars. Quality- excellent, 5 stars. Highly recommended, no regrets in buying this brand or style.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: There needs to be a way to insert one last ...
customer_reviews.text: There needs to be a way to insert one last bar in the top and the bottom to support the mattress
customer_reviews.author: Intriguing

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to set our California king on. Got the low profile box springs and now there's plenty of storage space under our bed. It does sit very high, but makes it easier to roll out of bed in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: James Avon

customer_reviews.title: however it’s really an excellent metal frame
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving 4 stars because I keep banging my toes into the hard metal legs, however it’s really an excellent metal frame. It’s high and feels great minus my toes... I am not a handy person but felt inspired by other reviews and was able to put the whole queen size frame together alone in less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

product_meta.title: SLEEPLACE 18 Inch High Profile Heavy Duty Steel Slat / Mattress Foundation / Bed Frame, California King
product_meta.description: Style:18 Inch| Size:California KingSLEEPLACE T-3000 Steel Slat Bed Frame is back with extra height. We have added 4 Inches, which makes the height to 18 Inches. 18 Inch high profile allows you to make full use for under bed storage, and forget the box springs. It is just the right height for everyone Easy assembly, yet strong bed frame. Forget the weak squeaking wood slats as well. Offering the best, just for you.
feature_bullets: Sturdy Steel slats can support heavier deluxe mattress, no worries from the slats breaking down
18 inch tall bed frame - more under-bed storage & box spring free
Dimensions: Outer (inner) [L x W x H]: 85. 5 (83. 5) x 73. 5 (71. 5) x 18 (16. 5) inches
Ultimate strength and durability - unique Steel slat structure & noise free Construction with reinforced Leg structure
Easy assembly. The frame is delivered packed in a box staright to your front door

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,027 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
